label: A2B3C7D_oP13_47_k_cj_aijl_f-001
title: 1212C [YBa$_{2}$Cu$_{3}$O$_{7-x}$] High-$T_{c}$ Structure
comments:
This is the superconducting phase of Ba$_{2}$YCu$_{3-x}$O$_{7-y}$.  Above 575$^\circ$C it transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C8D_tP14_123_h_bg_egi_c-001}{tetragonal phase}. (Nakai, 1987) 
 The designation 1212C is from (Shaked, 1994). In experiment the Ba (2k) site is 80\% occupied, and the O (2l) site is 92\% occupied, so $x$ = 0.16.  Excess oxygen may appear on the (2b) (1/2 0 ) site, {\em i.e.}, along the long axis. 
 AFLOW rotates the lattice taking ($x \rightarrow y \rightarrow z \rightarrow x$) and also shifts the origin to move the single oxygen atom from the (1e) to the (1a) site.
